DOC.brief_summary: Although a proportion of pyogenic liver abscess may originated from colonic mucosal lesions, the prevalence of colonic neoplasm in the patients with pyogenic liver abscess are still not evaluated yet. Thus, our group will find the prevalence of colonic neoplasm in the group of cryptogenic pyogenic liver abscess by colonoscopic examination.
DOC.brief_title: Prevalence of Colon Cancer in Pyogenic Liver Abscess
DOC.criteria: Pyogenic liver abscess radiologically and bacteriologically diagnosed Amebic liver abscess Other causes of pyogenic liver abscess such as cholangitis, liver cancer, complication of transarterial chemoembolization or radiofrequency ablation to hepatocellular carcinoma Refusal to colonoscopic examination Inadequate general patient status to perform the colonoscopic examination Patient who has had the screening colonoscopic examination within 1 year and showed normal finding or had 1 or 2 colon polyp in adequate exam
